introduction.p:
We began our study of linear systems in where we described linear systems in terms of augmented matrices, such as
\left[ \begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 \amp 2 \amp -1 \amp 3 \\ -3 \amp 3 \amp -1 \amp 2 \\ 2 \amp 3 \amp 2 \amp -1 \\ \end{array} \right]
In this chapter, we will uncover geometric information in a matrix like this, which will lead to an intuitive understanding of the insights we previously gained into the solutions of linear systems.
